intro: Alsine skorpilii, commonly known as the Balkan sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
